personal_info.name: Charles Hanna
personal_info.description: I’m driven by my passion to efficiently solve problems, by my curiosity to incessantly explore the infinite technological universe, and by my determination to work with teams to ship inclusive, scalable, and performant clean code. I learn everyday to become a better developer, a better leader, and most importantly a better human.

entries.title: Team Lead Frontend Web Developer
desc_list: While I was still doing lots of technical development, I managed a team of frontend developers, with one developer located in a completely different timezone.
Held bi-weekly 1:1 meetings, through which provided coaching and mentorship to each team member.

Organized weekly grooming and task review sessions with my team and mangers, in an effort to plan the work for the upcoming sprints, eliminate any blockers and provide better understanding of the sprint tasks.
Planned and conducted technical interviews, and on-boarded new devs who joined the team.

entries.title: Senior Frontend Web Developer
desc_list: Migrated the Javascript codebase from gulp to Webpack, where a significant performance gain was acquired due to tree shaking and code splitting.
Converted the Javascript codebase to use plain vanilla Javascript rather than jQuery, which was retired after the project was completed.
Helped fellow colleagues in the Marketing department with technical difficulties, specially issues related to the WordPress setup.
Engaged in regular code reviews, in pair programming sessions, and regularly take time to help fellow developers with technical challenges.

entries.title: Frontend Web Developer
desc_list: Worked with content editors and web designers to create many building blocks modules for the site using Advanced Custom Fields WordPress plugin.
Handled full-stack projects from start to finish, where I've written OOP PHP, SQL queries,  plain JS functionality, and SASS rules.
Restructured the whole CSS codebase, creating predefined rules (vars, mixins and functions) using SASS, in order to adapt it to the existing brand identity, yet making it easy to update.
